item.title: Fly tip including GAS Cylinder and now burnt Material at the location, 13th March
item.description:
The location is the entrance and PUBLIC Foot Path to the Old Quarry off Cleeve Common Road. Some cabling put there on Saturday has been now burnt and additional material has joined the tip - probably Saturday night, in the form of a Gas Cylinder, appliances and a plastic tub of rubbish together with two bags of rubbish. As the the cylinder poses a special hazard - please can this be cleared up as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in lay-by, 12th March
item.description:
Flytipped rubbish dumped in hedge at lay-by. Bags of rubbish and what looks like rubble and a door. The litter and mess along this stretch of road is awful.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elm Gardens Badgeworth Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep hole, plus more problems., 12th March
item.description:
Between Alma Rd and Morrisons, the whole stretch of Caernarvon Rd is in quite a state. In particular, at one of the two mini roundabouts, there is a 6”deep pothole which is very hard to avoid as it’s at the junction and in line with left wheels. Please cub this stretch be inspected, and consideration given to more substantial repair. I would suggest this is worse state than both Salisbury Ave and Robert Burns road which have both been resurfaced recently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 151 Caernarvon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress and chair left behind., 12th March
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 38 Cleeveland Street, Cheltenham
